How to set ValkuntOS as default launcher?
1. Go to Settings → \'Set as default launcher\'\n2. Or go to Android Settings → Apps → Default Apps → Launcher\n3. Select Vulsoft OS from the list
Why does Vulsoft OS request permissions?

• Notification Access: To display notification badges
• Modify Settings: To change wallpapers
• Display over other apps: For widgets and overlays
• Autostart: To activate on boot

Go to Settings and choose from:
• Dark: Elegant dark theme
• Amoled: Pure black with neon colors
• System: Adapts to system settings
• Glass: Modern glassmorphism effect

1. Go to Settings → 'Modify Widgets'
2. Drag widgets to move them
3. Resize with handles
4. Change colors in settings
5. Press Back to exit edit mode

6 available colors:
• White & Black (Classic)
• Glass (Indigo Blue)
• Red, Green, Orange (Vivid colors)

• Long press an icon to move it
• Drag to the dock to pin it
• Use 'Reorganize' in settings to reset
• Create folders by overlapping apps

• Drag an app to the dock to add it
• Long press an app in the dock to remove it
• Maximum 4 apps in the dock
• Enable/Disable background in settings

• Type in the top search bar
• Results appear in real-time
• Press Enter to launch the first app
• Clear to return to normal view

• Double-click (empty): Open AI Assistant
• Long press (empty): View recent apps
• Long press (icon): Menu / Edit Mode
• Drag an app: Move or delete
Double-click anywhere on the home screen to launch the Assistant. It can open apps, tell you the time, date, and more. You can also open it from Settings.
Long press on an empty space. A window will appear with your recent apps and a quick search bar.
The launcher is slow, what to do?

• Restart the app
• Check system permissions
• Reduce blur effects in settings
• Free up memory by closing other apps
• Reset app layout if necessary
I found a bug, how to report it?

• Note the steps to reproduce the problem
• Check your Android version
• Try restarting the application
• Contact support with a detailed description
